programme.title: Captain Smith's Saturday Afternoon Ice Briefing
programme.desc: Lightoller’s testimony before the commission confirms Captain Smith’s ice briefing to his officers long before Titanic reached the ice field.

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 2
programme.desc: In the second part of this two-part series, Host Ken Marschall continues his remembrance of his friend Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: Trapped in a Tunnel
programme.desc: Senan Molony digs into the Titanic archives and finds a remarkable story of a greaser - trapped and then rescued from one of the most obscure and forgotten parts of the ship.

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero!

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: How Did Titanic Sink?
programme.desc: He’s visited the wreck more than 30 times in the last 25 years. P.H. Nargeolet gives us his personal observations about the wreck and how Titanic might have gone down.

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Another View on the Coal Burning Fire
programme.desc: A recent documentary presented new theories about the coal burning fire onboard Titanic. Parks Stephenson gives his view of the fire and how it affected Titanic. Senan Molony and Parks Stephenson, two of our hosts, are on Titanic’s center stage!

programme.title: More Life Boats Would Not Have Helped
programme.desc: Have we been wrong all these years in thinking that more lifeboats would have saved lives? Haas makes a compelling case that this may have been just too simple of an answer.

programme.title: The Anchor Crane Mystery - Ken Marschall
programme.desc: When the first images of Titanic came back in 1985, everyone noticed how the bow anchor crane was turned to a very unusual position; even considering the crash into the ocean floor. Jim Cameron’s got one theory about what happened and Ken Marschall’s...

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: The Story Behind Titanic's Real Time Sinking
programme.desc: Tom Lynskey and Matt DeWinkeleer take us behind the scenes of their amazingly popular 2 hour 40 minute Titanic Sinks in REAL TIME. With over 17,670,154 views, it definitely captured the world’s attention.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: An Enduring Mystery
programme.desc: It’s the million-dollar question in maritime history! Who was this ship that sailed close to Titanic and could quite possibly have saved everyone on board? Very few Titanic scholars have looked into this more than Senan Molony. Here’s his take on...

programme.title: Vendée Globe 2024 - Mag #7 (Eng)
programme.desc: While the three leaders are fighting at the front, the second half of the competitors are having a difficult time. This weeks expert is Maxime Sorel who had to give up. Also in this episode an interview with Guillaume Verdier, the architect of most of the lead boats.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle-Kite World Cup Colombia 2023
programme.desc: Salinas del Rey, Colombia, is a great location added to the GKA Kite World Tour in 2022. This spot is heralded as one of the best wave riding and flat water spots on the Colombian Caribbean coast. Therefore this kitesurfing paradise hosts the second stop of the 2023 World Tour season! Here Freestyle and Big Air tricks make this the perfect destination for a spectacular freestyle event

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Big Air World Cup 2024 Brazil
programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour is set to electrify the shores of Jericoacoara, Brazil, with high-stakes competition in its three big air divisions - TwinTip, Hydrofoil and Surfboard. Making its debut at this iconic Brazilian kiteboarding spot, a total of 57 athletes compete for world titles in the Surfboard and Hydrofoil disciplines, while the TwinTip division host a normal World Cup event.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 Ibiraquera Brazil
programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour is excited to hit Ibiraquera in Brazil in 2024 for a Kite-Surf World Cup event.The top riders from across the globe perform at the paradise of Ibiraquera, a brand new location for the Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour!

programme.title: ÖTILLÖ Swimrun Cannes 2022 Official Film
programme.desc: The course of this race is a true ÖTILLÖ Swimrun World Series course with islands to cross and lots of fantastic nature. It is challenging and fun with two big hills, single track trails, amazing views and beautiful water to swim in. For those who are for the first time racing in Cannes, they are up for a surprise. To finish on the beach in front of Hotel Martinez is a treat.

programme.title: Inside Sailing 2025 - Episode 4
programme.desc: In our previous episode, we travelled to Oman for a non-competitive, yet exciting adventure, the Oman Downwinder. We also featured Match Racing action. As always, our eyes were also in the future of sport. For the 10th year in a row, the Saronicos Bay was “home” for the “Nikos Sarikavazis Trophy”. We start this episode with Mallorca for the Trofeo Princesa Sofía Mallorca by FERGUS Hotels. We will once again bring foiling to the spotlight of Inside Sailing. Foiling Week is the first and only global event of its kind dedicated to a range of foiling boats and boards, bringing together athletes, designers, and manufacturers from across the globe.Let’s now focus further on one of the foiling disciplines : the wing foiling and the Wing Foil Racing World Cup. A new season has just started for this sport and Inside Sailing will bring all the action during the next months.

programme.title: The First Second - Vivian Bruchez
programme.desc: Ses yeux ne quittent jamais la montagne… Du premier coup d’oeil sur une face à la vision exigeante qui englobera tout, Vivian Bruchez avance comme un explorateur. Sa pratique de la pente raide est une marche vers l’inconnu, aussi enthousiaste que méthodique , une quête minutieuse du moindre détail, un parcours vers l‘accord avec lui-même.Vivian Bruchez - The Steep search. His eyes never leave the mountain ... From the first glance at a demanding vision that will encompass everything, Vivian Bruchez moves forward like an explorer. His practice of the steep slope is a march towards the unknown, as enthusiastic as it is methodical, a meticulous quest for the smallest detail, a journey towards agreement with himself.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2024 #2
programme.desc: La Pierra Menta est devenue au fil des 37 éditions, la compétition de ski-alpinisme de référence, un passage obligé pour l’élite de la discipline. Elle rassemble tous les ans plus de 200 cordées de 2 skieurs. Coup double pour les équipes masculines et féminines françaises qui lemportent dans cette deuxième étape et prennent la tête du classement général à la mi-course

programme.title: Dark Peak Fell Runners
programme.desc: The Dark Peak Fell Runners base themselves in Sheffield, but their playground is the Peak District National Park where they weave tracks through the fields, peat bogs and rocky outcrops to create a tapestry of eccentricity, endeavour and endurance. As one of the biggest pure fell running clubs in the UK, the ‘Dark Peak Fell Runners’ captures the personality, quirks and successes of the club and its members. Shot throughout the course of a year, the film follows in their footsteps to reveal their well-trodden Peak District running routes including the club’s flagship race, the Edale Skyline. (Special Thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2025
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe. This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #2
programme.desc: Les coureurs ont pu profiter de la ferveur populaire des habitants du village d’Arêches, au départ de cette2e étape, pour faire le plein d’énergie. Cette communion avec le public beaufortain faisait figure de prologue à une étape décrite par les participants comme la plus difficile vécue avec ses 5 cols, 31 km, 3350 m de D+ et 3165 m deD-. Les chutes de neige de la nuit encore actives le matin ont largement contribué à alourdir l’effort malgré un énorme travail des bénévoles pour entretenir la trace.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2024 #3
programme.desc: La Pierra Menta est devenue au fil des 37 éditions, la compétition de ski-alpinisme de référence, un passage obligé pour l’élite de la discipline. Elle rassemble tous les ans plus de 200 cordées de 2 skieurs. Tour de force au sommet du grand mont! les équipes masculines et féminines françaises confortent leur première place au classement général de la Pierra Menta au cœur dune troisième étape clé pour la victoire finale

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #3
programme.desc: Cette 3e et avant dernière étape servait de répétition du grand final de demain où, si la météo le permet, la course franchira le col de la Forclaz. Ce col situé au pied du Grand Mont est le théâtre d’une communion, sans égale depuis39 ans, entre les coureurs et les milliers de spectateurs massés à 2.374 m.

programme.title: Open Faces 2024
programme.desc: The most important Freeride World Tour Qualifier Series in Europe celebrated the start of the 10th season with the 2* FWT Qualifier competition. In challenging conditions the riders show their skills and offer top-class performances on the Quellspitze in Kappl/Paznaun.

programme.title: Climbing Skye's Highest Peak - Sgurr Alasdair
programme.desc: Cris and Viv decided to climb Sgurr Alasdair, the highest mountain on the island of Skye, located in an area of the mountain range known as Black Cullin. The main challenge they had in climbing the peak was the Great Stone Chute. A 300-meter slope of the harshest mountain terrain - scree. The summit of Sgurr Alasdair has unobstructed views of all of the Munroes in the Black Cullin, and also of one of Skyes most famous routes - The Cullin Ridge traverse.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2023 Rd1 Baqueira Beret Spain
programme.desc: The 2023 Freeride World Tour kicks off in January in its 16th season – as usual with the best freeriders all over the globe! The first stop of the tour takes place in Baqueira Beret who plays again host, following the success of last year’s inaugural event at this epic venue. Consistent snowfall and varied terrain make this world-class resort an ideal test for freeride fanatics.The judging criteria at the Freeride World Tour are: Difficulty of Line, Control, Fluidity, Jumps & Technique.

programme.title: Summiting Mt Sneffels in Colorado (Eng)
programme.desc: Mount Sneffels is a prominent mountain near Ouray, Colorado in the United States which is over 14,000 feet high, more than 4,300 metres. Audree had never climbed a 14er, so we decided to try reach its summit while on a road trip through Colorado in late-July.

programme.title: Norvan Falls
programme.desc: A group of us pay a visit to one of our favourite local waterfalls, Norvan Falls in North Vancouver, BC. Youll also get a look at how the falls look when frozen mid-winter.

programme.title: Giorgio Benussi - The interview
programme.desc: Rachele Vitello is inside The Boat Show studios with Giorgio Benussi, Co-Founder of Sail Class 659F. An interview not to be missed.

programme.title: Slam is back
programme.desc: Sandro Donato Grosso takes you to an exclusive event organized by Slam, a brand that deals with technical clothing for all boating enthusiasts. Discover the brand and discover the young promises of foiling and also Olympic champions

programme.title: America's Cup: Road to Barcelona
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is at the centro del villaggio che ospiterà la 37esima edizione dellAmericas Cup nel 2024.

programme.title: An habitability beyond its size
programme.desc: Discover the Sun Odyssey 410, built by Jeanneau and designed by Marc Lombard, the architect that defined the geometric and angular lines of this family cruiser. The habitability of this model goes beyond its size of 12 meters, assuring a pleasant sailing and living experience.

programme.title: Wallypower58 Power - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the Wallypower58 Power, newly arrived in America. Bill Hackett interviews Stefano De Vivo.

programme.title: Scout Boats – Miami International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett sits down with Alan Lang, Director of Sales and Marketing for Scout Boats, to talk about the legacy of the Scout Boats range and the debut of the Scout Boats 670 in September.

programme.title: Palm Beach International Boat Show 2024 – Highlights
programme.desc: Experience the boating season at the 2024 Palm Beach International Boat Show, featuring yachts and accessories in every category in the heart of West Palm Beach. Dont miss the perfect mix of luxury, fun and world-class entertainment.

programme.title: Silent Yachts Shipyard - Factory Tour
programme.desc: Follow us walking through the factory of the Silent Yachts, where green and sustainable solutions were tested with particular attention to its impact to the environment at the sea.

programme.title: Belassi Marine Hypercraft
programme.desc: Get ready for an exclusive visit. Our Maria Elisa Altese takes you inside Belassi Marine Hypercraft, a company that deals with high-speed emotions. Fasten your seat belts and get ready for an adrenaline rush! Race your heartbeat!

programme.title: Simrad - Glass Bridge systems
programme.desc: Hop on board the maxi rib Ranieri International Cayman 45.0 Cruiser and test the Glass Bridge systems by Simrad, with two monitors that display a lot of information.

programme.title: Hall of fame - Mitja Gialutz
programme.desc: The Boat Show invites Mitja Gialuz, President of Società Velica Barcola, organizer of the famous Barcolana regatta. Discover this exclusive interview.

programme.title: Best of Boot - 2023
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese and Federico Maselli bring you to the Boot, the International Boat Show in Dusseldorf. Discover the latest trends, the new accessories and technologies.

programme.title: Denison Yachting - Miami 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the Miami International Boat Show and she is about to Interview Bob Denison, CEO Denison Yachting.

programme.title: Raymarine - YachtSense Ecosystem
programme.desc: Hop on the FIM Regina 470 to test Raymarine’s full optional onboard electronics.

programme.title: Edoardo Recchi – The interview
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese interviews for you Edoardo Recchi, Sports Director of the Yacht Club Costa Emerald.

programme.title: RINA SERVICES
programme.desc: Justin Ratcliffe interviews Paolo Moretti, CEO of RINA SERVICES, a company that originated as a maritime classification society and has now diversified its activities.

programme.title: Suncoast Boat Show (Eng)
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Suncoast Boat Show, a must-see event for boating enthusiasts and industry professionals, and Bill Hackett provides a detailed overview of the boats on display.

programme.title: Venice Boat Show 2021 part 1

programme.desc: In Sommores luminous, new stand-up special, the Undisputed "Queen of Comedy" brings her sexy brand of humor to Miami. No topic is off limits.

programme.title: Newlyweeds
programme.desc: A match made in stoner heaven turns into a love triangle gone awry when Lyle cant decide which matters most, Nina or Mary Jane.

programme.title: Torments of Love
programme.desc: On an island off the coast of Guadeloupe, two sisters, Myriam and Vanessa, have planned to stay for a few days in the family house, where the sweet memory of their grandmother is still vivid. But Vanessa is not aware that a particular guest is expected for lunch. When she catches sight of her father, a cold and quiet man that she didnt want to see anymore, it is too late to escape the confrontation. Around the table, unsaid things, provocations and blunders will lead each individual to face their own ambiguous feelings.

programme.title: Engines 3 and 9
programme.desc: We finish up a 24 hour shift with the crew from Engine 9 who finish with a morning structure fire. The next 24 hours back at Station 9 with firefighter Robert Castillion, he just made Captain at the busiest station in Fresno, Station 3. Garcia is the Engineer. A call comes in, its a rubbish fire. Its Night, we are back at Station 9, to find the crew in the engine bay doing todays exercise. Then, the call comes in, with both engine companies responding. Engine 3 is on-scene with Truck 4 when Engine 9 arrives. Tonight they are testing out some Key Combat Ready Hose line, it pulls out great; they are in on this mattress wherehouse fire for a little while.

programme.title: Eng 3 Apartment Fire Part 1
programme.desc: The crew of Engine 3s "A" Shift start their day with some of the best tacos in town, a call comes for a fire; the arrive on-scene to a mattress fire possibly set by a homeless person. Then a call comes in for a structure fire. They arrive on scene to a second floor apartment. Captain Palmer takes Command and his crew go into action. Firemen is Garcia on the pump panel, Firefighter Silva pulls the nozzle up the steps, and safely puts on his PPE and they head into the fire.Arson investigation arrives on scene. Back at the station, a quick bit of food, and another call comes in for a structure fire and the Palmer and the crew head out the door.

programme.title: A day with Traveler David Ramirez at Engine 3
programme.desc: Station 3, Engine 3 "A" Shift with Captain Palmer. Travelers are Firefighters without a Station for a home, and they cover all firefighters at all the stations in a Battalion. Today, we are with Firefighter David Ramirez as he works in the kitchen on some chow. A fire alarm goes off, and the firemen arrive on scene to find a leak. They find the main valve and take care of the problem. Next, a call comes in for a structure fire, and the firemen arrive on-scene to find a homeless person operating a BBQ inside a vacant home that is supposed to be secured by this plywood. Engine 3 has to deal with a tremendous amount of homeless in this part of town. Next, another structure fire, its busy day in the high heat of Central California, The building is vacant, but still dangerous.

programme.title: Part 2 of 24 with Engine 3
programme.desc: Firefighter/engineer Chris Garcias family drops by for Easter Sunday. The guys are in the kitchen cooking up lunch, and a call comes and they are onto the rig. The Fire Company arrives at the scene to a shooting. The police had been in a pursuit of gang bangers in a black SUV. They find them and a shoot out occurs and the police shoot a suspect to a killing. Next up, a vehicle accident. Night falls and a call comes in for a commercial structure fire. Eng. 3s "A" Shift is 1st in on a Antique Store fire owned by a horder.

programme.title: Storm Duck INT Sets Up Tar Heels Offense For Late 1st Half Score

programme.title: UNC Josh Downs Highlights Against Florida A&M

programme.title: Wake Forest's Mitch Griffis Finds Taylor Morin For The Sliding TD Grab | Must See Moment

programme.title: From kayaking to fitness workouts: Dubai enriches its offer for the health conscious traveller
programme.desc: With its untamed environment and rugged landscape, Hatta is the picture-perfect destination. And this centuries’ old exclave of Dubai also caters for today’s health conscious traveller. High up in the Hajar mountains you can soak up the history while doing a spot of hiking. There are 32 kilometres of track in the area. More than a dozen possible routes have been mapped out, with four different levels of ability. Kayaking is also on offer on the vast lake next to the Hatta dam. Fitness expert and Youtube star Lilly Sabri @lillysabri says the walking is an ideal complement to a regular routine. “I think that when you’re on a holiday you want to make memories as well… so trying different things,” she says. “So, if you’re someone goes to the gym wherever you normally train and in whatever country that might be, it might be nice to try something different. So, getting outside. You certainly couldn’t do this in London where I’m originally from. So, it’s keeping fit and healthy but in a different way.” Wellness tourism has evolved to become the travel industry’s fastest growing sector – something Dubai is continuing to expand upon and develop. Across town amongst the shimmering Jumeirah Lakes Towers you will find the SMSF Heartfulness Meditation Centre. It’s the only one of its kind in the MENA region and they hold daily meditation classes that attract up to 500 people. “I think we just forgot where... we’ve been so focused on external gratification... now people are actually zoning in and they realise what’s important on how we feel and how we can impact on those around us,” says fitness expert Christian Williams. “This place in Dubai is not just where people live, it’s a stop off where people go on vacation. So, what we’re doing here in Heartfulness Meditation is just incredible not just for people living here but anyone who is willing to come and travel. And I can just see us moving forwards and I’m just so pleased I came to this centre because it’s free and it’s on every single week.” “Dubai is gr

programme.title: "Veganity": World's largest vegan restaurant opened in Dubai
programme.desc: There is an undeniable trend towards a plant-based diet. In the UK, the number of vegans reportedly quadrupled between 2014 and 2018. Even fast-food giants are now offering vegan alternatives to meat. And here in Dubai, a restaurant billed as the worlds largest vegan restaurant (‘Veganity’) has just opened its doors. Veganity’s founder Sky Sommer’s business was borne of her desire to show people that having a plant-based diet does not have to be a sacrifice. With over 200 dishes on the menu, everything from soul food to gourmet food are on offer. Sommer’s favourite dish is Molokhia; a recipe which has its roots in Ancient Egypt. “Its actually the name of a leaf; a greeny leaf that looks like spinach. So you just put olive oil, onions and garlic and coriander. This is what gives it that kick. Tomato paste, white vinegar, vegetable stock. Once you add the molokhia and the tomato paste you just let it boil to render down a bit. It becomes a bit thick and then you just get a hand blender.” Below weve provided a delicious Vegan recipe for you to try at home. Recipe Laham Ajeen Chop tomatoes x4 Diced onions x2 Garlic diced x8 Parsley chopped x1 bunch Red capsicum small squares x1 Green capsicum small squares x1 Minced meat (TVP) 250g Cook all together with 3-4 tablespoons of olive oil for around 10 minutes then add the spices below until they are well combined: Paprika x 4 tablespoons 7 spices x 4 tablespoons Garlic powder x 2 tablespoons Vegan Worcester sauce x 1 tablespoons Tomato paste x 4 tablespoons Vegetable stock x 1 cup Leave to marinate for up to 1 hour stirring it every 15 min till all liquids have dissolved then serve with half a lemon slice. The dough 5 cups of flour of choice 2 cups water Pinch of salt Sieve the flour into a bowl Add the salt Slowly add the water bit by bit while mixing the dough, cover and let rest for 30 minutes in a cool place then roll out to a clean surface and need for 5 min. Then cut the dough into 3 inch balls and roll the do

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Jilsiru Tteok Cafe
programme.desc: At first blush, the Jilsiru Tteok Cafe may strike more adventurous explorers as a bit of a snoozefest. Its a cafe attached to an actual Tteok museum (koreans take their rice cakes seriously) inside the old, traditional Insadong neighborhood. Nothing new or trendy but its actually one of those places that you may find yourself wandering back into after your initial bad attitude. The first floor houses the Tteok Cafe where one can essentially purchase and eat every variety of Tteok known to mankind pretty much. The textures and fillings are as varied as the many colors that are on display and its easy to mindlessly go into a tteok-frenzy but it pays to be selective because theres only so much glutinous rice hunks one can eat in one sitting and tteok is known to go stale quickly.When youve had your fill of colorful starch, head up to the 2nd floor where you can find the museum part of the experience and learn about the thousands of years of tteok history. And if youre wanting a little more action after, head on over to the traditional Korean Liquor Museum which is in the same building.In total, this place really is a hub for Koreas days of yore, including spreads on North Korean cuisine and what emperors have been served . Just make sure you come brave enough to try the dried manta ray.

programme.title: Why day-trippers and holidaymakers are hooked on Dubai Marina
programme.desc: The glories of Dubai Marina Dubai Marina is much more than just a glamorous urban dock for luxury yachts (although its that as well!) Its also home to a huge range of chic bars and restaurants to suit all tastes and moods. And, of course, it has those iconic towers that define its famous skyline. One of the best ways to admire the architecture around Dubai Marina is from the deck of a boat. You can charter a private yacht, hop onboard an organised boat tour - or you can even cross the marina for as little as €2 in a water taxi. Five-star resorts hug the coastline. Their vast, marble-clad lobbies lead to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunch venues and postcard-perfect beaches. As for Dubai Marinas beach clubs, from Drift to Zero Gravity , they are dizzyingly beautiful; their pool decks are catwalks for the latest swimwear fashions. Jumereirah Beach Residence Jumeirah Beach Residence itself is the largest single-phase commercial and residential project in the world. Its strategically lined along a chic waterfront strip known as The Walk , feautring stunning 3D murals. The Walk has a very varied range of fashion, home and handicraft shops and boutiques. The outdoor pop-up market stalls offer jewellery, food treats and homeware, as well as performances by street entertainers. Jumereirah Beach Residence is made up of 40 high-rise buildings divided into six clusters, all with superb access to first-class retailers, entertainment venues and restaurants. Up on the Flying Cup The adjacent cosmopolitan shopping area The Beach has many attractions, including the floating adventure park Aqua Fun . This amazing water park makes a statement, by spelling out "I ♡ Dubai" via is pools and slides when seen from above. Another highlight at The Beach is The Flying Cup , a ride that you can sit in and be elevated to fabulous views, seen in all their glory from 40 metres up - while eating and drinking! From the top, you can see Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah and, of course, that wonderful Duba

programme.title: Animal conservation "a government priority" says United Arab Emirates
programme.desc: Dubai and the United Arab Emirates are making animal conservation a government priority at a time when biodiversity is under threat and more animals face extinction globally. A report by the United Nations earlier this year claimed animal extinctions are at an unprecedented high. According to the organisation, as many as one million species are under threat. On a visit to the desert, you might expect to find camels or antelope, maybe some hawks. But Dubai’s Al Marmoom animal sanctuary is teeming with biodiversity with hundreds of different species of birds, mammals, and reptiles. The sanctuary covers 20 percent of the whole area of Dubai. In the beginning, it was a desert populated by native animals, but as the sanctuary expanded to more than 50 oases, it was discovered these water bodies could control the environmental balance. The sanctuary has even managed to attract the Arabian Oryx. This animal was declared extinct in the wild in 1972, but has now been brought back from the brink by the reserve. Saoud Faisal is a wildlife officer at the Al Marmoom sanctuary. He says in the 80s and 90s the Oryx were overhunted for food. Now the animal is considered part of the regions wildlife. “They are totally protected now and also they are healthy,” he explains. “We have them in large numbers which last year reached more than 500." From desert oases to indoor tropical environments, recent laws in Dubai mean greater governmental support for animal sanctuaries. Laws were introduced in 2007 to cover animal welfare, but awareness really started to build in 2016. The laws also apply to rare and exotic animals. Some are looked after in animal sanctuaries like Green Planet. Everything about Green Planet was designed specifically to create the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals in the middle of the Dubai desert. The sanctuary houses a wide range of species including many different birds, and mammals such as two-toed sloths. And lizards like green iguanas or basilisks. The latest addition t

programme.title: Kanda
programme.desc: One way to think about Kanda is to picture early Brooklyn, before the hipsters completely took over. It’s a place that perfectly embodies old and new Tokyo, a university town that attracts more than students. It’s a great place to live (some even think it’s one of the best kept secrets of Tokyo) with just about everything you need in one place — restaurants, nightlife, shopping, and easy access to just about any other part of the city. While tall gleaming skyscrapers haven’t taken over the landscape like much of Tokyo, there’s a good balance of historical and contemporary architecture to keep things interesting.Walk around and you’ll find neighborhood pockets that focusing on one thing: an entire street of used bookstores, another with stores and stores hawking vintage and new guitars; a three-story mecca for old-school arcade games; an entire block for ski and snowboarding gear. You can find Michelin-starred restaurants, gyoza specialists, internationally known ramen shops, and even great burger joints around the corner from each other. With friendly and fiercely proud locals who want to share the area’s history, from origami to the Kanda Myojin Shrine, this is a quieter part of Tokyo just waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: La Mer, Dubai’s newest beachfront neighbourhood, offers hip restaurants, water sports and fun parks
programme.desc: With the construction of Dubai’s latest luxury residential development, Port de La Mer by Meraas , and new hotel, Rove La Mer , La Mer is a of rising interest in today’s property market. La Mer, open since 2017, is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside neighbourhoods, nestled on the northern shoreline. Divided into two areas, La Mer South and La Mer North, it’s defined by its retro Californian style. The Instagram-friendly destination offers a heady mix of water sports, fun parks, fashionable restaurants, street art and seasonal parties after dark. By day, visitors can hire sunbeds or rent wooden day rooms on La Mer Beach. The multi-coloured beach huts house showers. La Mer beach club, Train , is fully licensed with a shisha area, but its name is derived from its fitness facilities – it has a gym and a boxing and yoga studio – and its Origin 33 restaurant and lounge also serves healthy meals and a menu of fresh juices and smoothies. The best restaurants in La Mer, according to local award-givers, include Masti , a beachfront eatery applauded for its modern Indian cuisine, innovative mixology and eclectic interior design by Studio Lotus. The name Masti is derived from the Hindi word for fun and mischief and the décor and dishes live up to the name, with cheeky monkey artwork and playful fusions for the palate such as the tandoori chicken bao. Another creative culinary outlet is iScream . Managing Partner Rami Halawi came up with the concept for iScream with his family. Offering a wide selection of unusual flavours is the brand’s unique selling point. “Here at iScream, we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, tabbouleh, ketchup and Mexican chilli-chocolate,” says Rami. On certain days, customers are invited to scream into a sound monitor for their ice cream – if they beat the highest recording in decibels, they win their ice cream for free. La Mer’s shops focus on beach pursuits and accessories, making it a good place to shop for swimwear, sunglasses, suntan lotion

programme.title: Find out why medical tourism is big business in Dubai
programme.desc: Medical tourism is a booming global industry, estimates on market size vary but the Patients Without Borders publishing group puts its value at around €60 to €80 billion worldwide, each year, with 20 to 24 million patients travelling for medical treatments annually. Around the world, aging populations, rising healthcare costs, and pressures on the insurance industry have created opportunities for destinations like Dubai , that have been able to invest rapidly in their healthcare infrastructure and capitalise on the sharp increase in demand for health tourism. Encouraging international institutions Dr Marwan Mohamed Al Mulla, CEO, Health Regulation Sector, Dubai Health Authority said, “Recently a new law has come into effect which encourages and allows international institutions to have their own, 100 percent ownership The Dubai Health Authority has had a medical tourism strategy in place since 2014 with the aim of developing and supporting its healthcare sector and steadily increasing its contribution towards Dubais gross domestic product. Focusing on an inbound patient’s airport-to-airport needs has helped providers capitalise too. Dr Basel Nasrallah, Medical Director, Armada said, “We in our facility, for example, get about 5 percent more patients from abroad. Patients are coming from all around the world. We are receiving patients from Russia, mainly Europe, Italy, Spain, UK, and North America from Africa, from South Asia Why have health checks in Dubai? Interestingly, many of those countries are known for the strength of their own medical tourism offerings, but Dubai is still an attractive option for patients who are looking to combine their treatments with other pursuits. Alexander Edwards, Surgical Patient, from the UK said, “Well there were multiple aspects I looked at prior to coming obviously looking at the time it takes, for the recovery period. I had all the research done before I came and found some fantastic reviews, very positive feedback from other friends and family that

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: Working While Black: Overcoming Racial Bias, Microagressions & Burnout
programme.desc: Learn tips and tools from executives who have successfully overcome the most common and unique hurdles that we face in business. Unchecked and these can do damage by derailing us. Alisa Gumbs, Executive Managing Editor for Black Enterprise, leads a panel discussion with Karen S. Carter, Chief Human Resources Officer & Chief Inclusion Officer at Dow Chemical Co.; Minda Harts, Founder & CEO, The Memo LLC; and Sandra Sims-Williams, Senior Vice President for Diversity & Inclusion at Nielsen, to explore, demystify and help strip these common detailers of their power. Lessons from the 2020 Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit.

programme.title: The Black-owned Cannabis Conference In Atlanta, GA

Then Michael Sprague, COO of KIA Motors, shows off its luxury K900. Then we get an inside look at diversity in the auto industry with The National Association of Minority Automobile Dealers president Damon Lester and Marc Bland, vice president of Diversity & inclusion at IHS Automotive. And finally, we sit down with head of design at FiatChrysler, Ralph Gilles, who gives us a glimpse of the minivan thats making major waves with critics and customers.

programme.title: A Candid Conversation on the Travel Industry & The Pandemics of Covid-19 and Race
programme.desc: A transformational force in the travel industry for over three decades, Doug Parker serves as CEO for American Airlines, one of the world’s largest carriers. In an exclusive interview with Black Enterprise CEO Butch Graves, Parker reveals how he has led the company through industrial change, a devastating pandemic and current shift in corporate inclusion and racial equality.

programme.title: Misty Copeland is making power moves on stage and screen
programme.desc: On this edition, we profile the principal ballerina at the American Ballet Theatre, Misty Copeland, who is making power moves on stage and on screen with the help of her business partner, Gilda Squire. We talk to both of them about the strategy to refine Ballet as a sport. Then, we look back at Ntzoke Shange, the playwright and poet who helped to shape the black arts movement. Plus, we talk to Nikki Giovanni, who many consider one of the world’s most beloved African Americans poets. And finally, look back at former Essence editor in chief Susan Taylor and her new mission to help young people.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise Of Fredia Gibbs
programme.desc: S1:E6 Fredia Gibbs was the first female African American kickboxing world champion who learned how to fight as a child because she grew up scared and afraid. It wasn’t until she unknowingly got into a van alone after a party with a man who turned out to be a serial killer, that all the years of fighting and training would help her unleash the power she had inside of her and catapult her to new heights.

programme.title: The Rise of Rocky NoHands
programme.desc: S1:E4 How would you feel if you lost in Fortnite to one of the worlds best players, and found out he was using his mouth as a controller? RockyNoHands is a professional eSports Fortnite player, making a career of playing a video game he loves and being among the best in the world at it. After the darkest moment of Rocky’s life left him paralyzed and motionless in a hospital bed, doctors told him he may never walk again. It wasn’t until a source of pure motivation forced him to dig deep to find his unbreakable drive, that he was able to take on his biggest and most rewarding challenge yet.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: Anna Faris vs. Chris Pratt
programme.desc: S1:E6 If Chris Pratt didn’t have an affair with Jennifer Lawrence, why did he file for divorce From Anna Faris? Chris Pratt and Anna Faris were the famous, ideal couple the world couldn’t get enough of. But when Chris Pratt skyrocketed into superstardom, Anna felt more and more insecure. Then, rumors of Chris having an affair with co-star Jennifer Lawrence emerged. Even though they both deny having an affair, Chris and Annas sudden divorce, fallout of their personal lives, and the health of their son caused a media frenzy that our team got to the bottom of.

programme.title: Jennifer Aniston vs. Brangelina
programme.desc: S1:E12 For almost 20 years, the media portrayed Jennifer Aniston as a heartbroken woman who would never be happy until she had kids. That couldn’t be further from the truth. Our team uncovered details that will prove Brad and Jennifer were the perfect Hollywood couple everybody adored, until Brad suddenly left Jen for Angelina Jolie. This story is so much bigger than Brangelina.

programme.title: Winona Ryder vs. Johnny Depp
programme.desc: S1: E10 Johnny Depp’s trial with Amber Heard had everyone talking, but wait until you hear about Winona Ryder’s. Johnny experienced love at first sight and became obsessed with Winona. But after their breakup, Winona dealt with mental health issues and her own very public trial, which has some striking similarities with Johnny and Ambers. Everyone thought she was a crazy, and the aftermath of her court case left her banished from the world. Winona went through a great awakening outside of the public eye and bounced back into Hollywood.

programme.title: Justin Bieber Vs. Hailey Bieber
programme.desc: S2:E7 Justin and Hailey Bieber are at the height of their careers. So why do they keep getting sick? Our team uncovers this isn’t the first time one of Justin’s love interests has had a life-threatening illness. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Selena Gomez with Hailey?

programme.title: Kristen Stewart vs. Robert Pattinson
programme.desc: S1:E2 Every girl wanted to be Bella Swan in the blockbuster movie, Twilight. When Kristen Stewart auditioned and got the role, she fell in love with co-star Robert Pattinson shortly after, and the world became obsessed with the new young couple. But what Kristen didn’t expect was the endless media scrutiny, paparazzi following her entire life, and the endless craze from fans. After getting caught in a shocking scandal and being villainized by the entire world. But the media got her story wrongKristen had to embrace her authenticity to have the courage to be who she truly was regardless of what the world thought. We dug into Kristen and Roberts romance to find the real life story behind the tabloids.

programme.title: GSP: Behind The Mask
programme.desc: As a child, Georges St-Pierre was bullied relentlessly by an older and much bigger boy at his school. He was tortured, and humiliated on a daily basis, leading to years of built up anger and frustration. It was this traumatizing childhood experience that led him to study martial arts and become one of the most celebrated UFC Champions in the world. Years later, Georges faced his childhood bully once again. What he chose to do in that moment is nothing short of amazing.

programme.title: Elizabeth Smart : Trapped and Lost
programme.desc: Elizabeth Smart was carried off at 14 years old and was missing for 9 grueling months. Those were the worst months of her life, the details of which were so terrible, she refused to share her story for ten years… until something changed. This is her story of survival and strength.

programme.title: The Dark Past Of Funny Man Tyler Perry
programme.desc: Tyler Perry stepped into the limelight with his character, Madea. He played a hilarious, tough-love woman who shared countless lessons on self-esteem, respecting yourself, and staying strong. Behind the scenes though, Tyler lived a life of bitterness and rage. There was one person he couldn’t forgive and it nearly cost him everything.

programme.title: Surviving A Death March
programme.desc: Forced to march over 350 miles, Gerda Weissmann Klein was moments away from sub-zero death when she survived the impossible. How did Gerda fight to survive when fewer than 120 people came out alive? And what simple gesture restored her faith in humanity?

programme.title: Michaela DePrince: From Devil's Child to Ballerina
programme.desc: Most people told Michaela DePrince that life as a ballerina would bring a lot of heartbreak and rejection. But what Michaela faced in the ballet world was nothing compared to her shocking orphanage childhood.

programme.title: The Dark Side of Elon Musk
programme.desc: Elon Musk, founder of SpaceX and CEO of Tesla, always found it hard fitting in with others. Hiding his painful secrets - Elon threw himself into his work, amassing huge success as an entrepreneur. But when he got caught up in the middle of a messy divorce with Amber Heard, Elon’s worst fears were realized and he hit a severe breaking point.

programme.title: Eva Mozes Kor: Surviving the Unthinkable
programme.desc: Eva Mozes Kor and her twin sister were tortured in Nazi Germany. She has held on to this secret for 40 years. And now, she finally tells her story.

programme.title: Katelyn Ohashi: For The Perfect 10
programme.desc: Top USA gymnast Katelyn Ohashi was the best gymnast in the world, until she became the target of relentless body shaming from her coach and social media. The elite gymnastics industry is notorious for body shaming, and when coach Valorie Kondos took over at UCLA, Katelyn rebelled against the stereotypes and her revenge went viral.

programme.title: Brian Bushway: Blind Sports
programme.desc: Record breaking mountain biker Brian Bushway became totally blind at the age of 14. He went from being an active teen outdoors to depression and uncertainty. He never thought he would be able to ride his bike again, until he developed a superpower that allowed him to see.

programme.title: Blue or Red pill?
programme.desc: Mindvalley founder Vishen Lakhiani shares the secret to success and teaches a confused student how to make the right decisions in life. The choice is yours: Will you take the blue pill or the red pill?

programme.title: Keys To Financial Freedom
programme.desc: Only 23 of Americans have saved over $50,000 for their retirement. How do you know when you are ready to retire? Ready financially ready emotionally? Retiring too early can leave you strapped financially or leave you feeling unfulfilled. Retiring without a plan in place for how your will utilize the funds you have or how to minimize your tax exposure can dramatically limit how far your funds will last.

programme.title: Your Money Your Wealth Retirement Vision Board: How to Plan for Your Financial Future
programme.desc: The first step in reaching any goal is to have a vision of what you want your future to look like. Do you have a vision of what you want your financial future to look like in retirement?See it believe it achieve it! Vision boards are popular these days and they can work to help you secure your financial future.What if your vision is to be a millionaire at retirement? Just start putting away the right amount of money each month and that vision can become a reality.

programme.title: 5 Steps to Know if Youre on Track to Retire
programme.desc: In this video, youll learn the 5 steps to know if youre on track to retire.

programme.title: Why a Monte Carlo Analysis Is Not a Financial Plan
programme.desc: Questions answered: What is a Monte Carlo analysis and how does it impact our retirement plan? What strategies can you implement to ensure you create your ideal retirement? What is the best strategy for your individual situation?

programme.title: Why Are More Americans Feeling TRAPPED In Advantage Plans?
programme.desc: In todays episode Marvin Musick from Medicare School puts special focus on Medicare Advantage Plans. He compares the three main Medicare choices: Original Medicare (Parts A and B), Medigap (supplemental insurance), and Medicare Advantage Plans. He underscores the financial vulnerabilities of relying solely on Original Medicare and the advantages of considering either Medigap or Medicare Advantage Plans to counter these risks. Marvin also addresses the critical concerns surrounding Medicare Advantage Plans. He highlights how these plans, while initially appealing due to their low upfront costs and additional services like dental care, can later reveal hidden limitations and unexpected expenses. This is a episode you WONT want to miss!

programme.title: "The Worst Supplemental Plan vs The BEST Paying A $282,000 Medical Bill"
programme.desc: "Many of you on Medicare have chosen a Supplemental Plan that has many benefits and can save you thousands in Medical bills. However, not all Supplemental plans are the same. In this episode, Medicare Schools Chief Educator Marvin Musick, will show you the best and worst Supplemental Plan for a $282K bill for lung cancer."

programme.title: 6 Secrets to Bigger Tax Savings
programme.desc: If you give a gift, the IRS will forgive a tax! Put away your checkbook - Joe Anderson, CFP® and special guest Allison Alley, CFP® show you six secrets to getting bigger tax savings from your donations to charity, including organizations like 501(c)(3) non-profits, churches, and schools.

programme.title: 9 Answers to Boost Tax-Free Roth Retirement Income
programme.desc: "Joe Anderson, CFP® and Big Al Clopine, CPA spitball on paying the tax on your Roth conversions on Your Money, Your Wealth podcast number 507. If you take the money out of your retirement account, what does Joe mean that you ll be paying the tax to pay the tax to pay the tax ? Can you pay it from the Roth itself, or from monthly pension tax withholding? Are the fellas wrong on this topic altogether? Plus, withdrawing Roth 401(k) contributions rolled to an IRA, the 5-year Roth withdrawal rules, saving to tax-deferred, taxable, or tax-free accounts, consolidating individual stock investments, the home office deduction, and a reviewer says Joe has checked out."

programme.title: 5 Simple Ways to Create a Happier Retirement
programme.desc: Retirement marks a significant transition from work to a more relaxed lifestyle. While financial planning is crucial, other factors contribute to a fulfilling retirement.

programme.title: Retiring with a Younger Spouse? Here's What You Need to Know.
programme.desc: When theres an age gap between you and your spouse, there are a number of complexities to navigate in retirement. In this video, I explore the unique planning points you need to consider in such a scenario. I walk through a case study of Fred and Lisa, a couple facing the challenges and opportunities presented by their age difference. Fred, at 64, is approaching retirement, eager to make the most of his golden years. However, his wife Lisa is 53, a significant age gap. They find themselves grappling with the intricacies of planning a future that aligns with both their aspirations.

programme.desc: Tag along as TGR takes an amazing crew of new-school backcountry jibbers including Sage Cattabriga-Alosa and Kye Petersen to the pristine, ocean-view mountains of Seward, Alaska to see how they will use the landscape.

programme.title: Following Your Passions SD
programme.desc: Two legends of action sports Jeremy Jones and Selema Masekela sit down for an honest conversation over Sierra Nevadas about their careers and problems facing not only the action sports community but the world. Presented by Sierra Nevada Brewing Company, "The Journey is Greater Than The Reward" will challenge you to reflect on the past and your place in the future.

programme.title: Kakapo Crest
programme.desc: Tasmanian climbers Liz Oh and Rosie Hohnen are persuaded by filmmaker Olivia Page and a local kiwi stoat trapper, Ana Richards, to hike off-track deep into remote Fiordland, New Zealand, in search of a sabre-like peak. They surrender themselves to Ana's confidence in navigating them through terrain few have crossed, and in parts never traversed at all. They battle through vertical plants, gale force storms and dangerously loose rock - but not without humor.

programme.title: Connection SD
programme.desc: A highline project organized by passionate woman all around the globe. Eight girls from France, The Czech Republic and Canada decide to rig a half a kilometer long highline between two iconic rock towers in the Moab desert in Utah. They spend five days on the towers and not only do they connect these towers with a thin strap, which they then walk on, but they also find a connection with the sky, the earth and each other.

programme.title: Kayaking in the Laurentian Mountains
programme.desc: Join host, Ken Whiting, as he heads to the adventure-filled region of Québec that gets its' name from a chain of mountains the runs through it—the Laurentians. Join Ken as he explores the islands of Lac Poisson Blanc by sea kayak before putting his whitewater kayaking skills to the test on one of Eastern Canada's most popular rivers, the Rouge River.

programme.title: The Yukon Blues
programme.desc: Igor D’India’s epic journey down the Yukon River, across Canada & Alaska. 16000 km hitch-hiking and nearly 2000 km solo paddling with an “old-fashioned” approach to adventure. Without any assistance, radio, GPS or phone, just some solar panels to re-charge his audio/video equipment.

programme.title: All Or Nothing 2 SD
programme.desc: All Or Nothing 2 is a self supported project for the love of 2 wheel sports, filmed in the first six months of 2014 in countries such as Andorra, England, Portugal and Spain. Some of these young Spanish talents are the biggest stars in the sport worldwide. The overall focus of All Or Nothing 2 is on MTB, but also some BMX, Trials, Skateboard and Wingsuit.

programme.title: Sea Kayaking Killarney Provincial Park
programme.desc: A World Champion kayaker, the author of twelve best-selling instructional books and videos on paddling, and a YouTube influencer with approximately 14 million views to his videos, Ken Whiting is the host of Facing Waves. Now entering it's 8th season, Facing Waves celebrates the cultures, landscapes and adventures that surround the world’s top paddling destinations. The popular TV series resonates with those who share a passion for the outdoors and seek out authentic experiences.

programme.title: Wot A Night (1931)
programme.desc: On a dark and stormy night, Tom and Jerry, two ambitious cab drivers, wait outside a train station for fares. When two strange men in top hats disembark from their train, the hacks solicit them until they give in and ask for a ride to their castle. When the men stiff the fare, Tom and Jerry pursue them, only to be trapped inside the castle by a portcullis. They wander about the residence and encounter a fearsome-looking bat, a bathing, whistling skeleton, a veritable army of ghosts, and other assorted ghouls and goblins. After meeting a skeletal quartet in black-face, they find the two strange men again and discover they've been turned into skeletons as well, after which they escape the castle and run for their lives.

programme.title: A Dip in a the Pool
programme.desc: An American gambler on a trans-Atlantic liner goes into the pool that bets on how far ship sails each day. Expecting bad weather, he bets a low distance, but then the weather fines up. He must come up with a plan to slow the ship down.

programme.desc: Casper makes friends with a fox cub. But the new friendship is threatened when a fox hunter and his two hounds come on the scene.

programme.title: The Killer Shrews (1959)
programme.desc: On an isolated island, a small group of people are terrorized by giant voracious shrews in the midst of a hurricane.

programme.title: RUSTIN
programme.desc: Rustin is the story of Billy Stagen - former football hero, present small town sheriff and hero to everyone but himself. His comfortable way of life goes for a 180 as his 16 year old daughter that he has never met is brought into his life. Conflict comes to a head as Billy tries to raise his daughter and deal with the school thugs that are causing trouble in town.

programme.title: THE GOLDEN POMEGRANTE
programme.desc: Noa, a famous Israeli singer of Yemenite descent, prepares for a concert in Jerusalem. She is interrupted by an old Arab man who claims to have been her great-grandmothers close friend. He tells her about Mazal, a Jewish child-bride from Yemen, who preserves her religion, culture, family, and unique art, surviving the harsh, violent conditions of Jerusalem and the Holy Land in the late 19th through the mid-20th centuries. She becomes the mother of two, a young widow, and the familys breadwinner through her skills as a jeweler in gold and silver. In time, a woman of property and an ardent patriot, she prevails through the unfolding bloody decades while living in the Old City of Jerusalem. She heads a family of extraordinary, unforgettable characters and grows old in strength and determination, remaining true to her traditions and ideals.

programme.title: INVISIBLE YOUNG
programme.desc: Over a four-year period, Rachel lived on the streets of Seattle, saw close friends die, and she was herself beaten on several occasions. Michael was five years old when he was placed in foster care. Over the next 11 years, Michael would see over 70 different placements. Several times he ran away - life on the streets was more to his liking. Jacklyn grew up with a mother who was a perfect candidate for the TV show Hoarders. Jacklyn describes her father as a violent, abusive, alcoholic drug addict. So at 13 when a friend took her to meet some homeless kids living under a bridge in town, Jacklyn knew she had found a new life. She would spend the next eight years on the streets. Jackson had a more traditional home life. But early exposure to drugs in his teen years resulted in Jackson choosing homelessness upon graduating high school. After several years hopping trains and living on the streets, a near brush with death forced him to reassess his situation.

programme.title: Deivamagal Episode 8
programme.desc: Deivamagal is an Indian Tamil-language soap opera starring Vani Bhojan and Krishna. It was broadcast on Sun TV initially from Monday to Friday and later extended to Saturday at 8 PM from 25 March 2013 to 17 February 2018 for 1,466 episodes. The show replaced S. Kumarans successful soap, Thirumathi Selvam, and replaced by Nayagi. The show is produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S. Kumaran. This serial was shot in Pollachi, Chennai, Chengalpet, Hyderabad, Kerala, Puducherry, and Cuddalore. This is the first TV serial shot in the Bay of Bengal Plot Prakash his wife Sathyapriya and his eldest sister-in-law Gayathris conspiracies against their families to conquer Prakshs ancestral property Jai Hind Vilas.

Our team of experts strives to provide the latest trends and advice in the beauty and fashion industry to help our viewers look and feel their best. With Say Swag, you can expect high-quality content that is entertaining and informative, bringing you closer to your favorite celebrities and their unique lifestyles. Join us to discover the latest and greatest in fashion, beauty, and lifestyle.
